content.webTitle: The White House is a hot mess

fields.headline: The White House is a hot mess
fields.bodyText: After four months in crisis mode, Donald Trump’s White House appeared to be nearing a breaking point, as it struggled to defend against reports that the president spilled highly sensitive beans to Russian diplomats in a meeting last week, after he fired the FBI director. Trump: ‘I had absolute right’ National security adviser HR McMaster took over press secretary Sean Spicer’s daily briefing to assert that whatever Trump told the Russians was “wholly appropriate”. But even elected Republicans begged to differ. How Trump undercuts his staff “They are in a downward spiral right now and have got to figure out a way to come to grips with all that’s happening,” Tennessee senator Bob Corker said. “We could do with a little less drama from the White House,” majority leader Mitch McConnell said. Yates: Trump ignored my warnings “There is fear among … senior advisers about leaving [Trump] alone in meetings with foreign leaders,” the New York Times reported. Other reporters witnessed a drastic scene after aides Steve Bannon, Sean Spicer and Sarah Huckabee Sanders went into a meeting. Read the report Trump is scheduled to head out on an extended foreign trip on Friday, including to Israel, which was just revealed as the source of the highly sensitive information Trump was said to have let slip to the Russians.
